item.title: vanaiti, abhijit, nike
item.description:
Source: TW

A kuShANa coin showing the Eastern Iranic deity of victory vainaiti. In Zoroastrian branch of the tradition, the deity is the male vanant associated with the star Vega (ùõº Lyrae). This evidently goes back to the proto-I-Ir period in the least as the vedic abhijit has an identical connotation & etymology; e.g. the taittirIya shruti states: ‡§Ö‡•í‡§≠‡§ø‡•í‡§ú‡§Ø‡•ë‡§§‡•ç ‡§™‡•í‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡•ë‡§¶‡•ç ‡§Ö‡•í‡§≠‡§ø‡§ú‡§ø‡•ë‡§§‡•ç | The change in gender in the Eastern Iranosphere seems to be a departure from the ancestral state.
